docs.snippet: SHEFFIELD--Margaret, 77, died in her NYC apartment on April 30th, ending her courageous battle with Alpha 1 Antitrypsin Deficiency, a genetic disorder that led to her crippling lung disease. After attending the Brearley School and graduating from ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
SHEFFIELD--Margaret,

77, died in her NYC apartment on April 30th, ending her courageous battle with Alpha 1 Antitrypsin Deficiency, a genetic disorder that led to her crippling lung disease. After attending the Brearley School and graduating from Milton Academy and Smith College, she received her MA in English literature at New York University. Throughout her impressive career, Margaret taught literature and writing at varied institutions of higher learning, especially enjoying her unique courses at Bard College. Her many accomplishments demonstrated her creativity and her love for the arts and literature. A teacher, writer, editor, and arts critic, Margaret's diverse art and cultural essays were published in numerous art journals. Her major book, The Expressive Edge, is an analysis of form in sculpture that came out in 2010, and The Blue Tibetan Poppy, a collection of her poems and watercolors, was published in 2015. She spent most of her life in NYC, but loved to travel and spent six years living in Italy. Margaret was actively involved in her club, the Century Association. In 1981 she married Piero Mannoni; they separated in 1993. She is survived by her siblings, Jim and Ann, and her step-daughters Francesca and Alessandra. Margaret, and her charming whimsy, will be greatly missed by her family, her wide circle of friends, and her beloved dog Giorgio. A private Memorial Service will be held on June 14. For details: jimsheff@gmail.com. Margaret asked that contributions be made to Alpha 1.org, the non-profit organization dedicated to finding a cure for her disease.

headline.main: Shell: Skimmers in Gulf Begin to Clean 88,200 Gallon Spill
headline.print_headline: Shell: Skimmers in Gulf Begin to Clean 88,200 Gallon Spill

docs.snippet: Vessels have begun cleaning up an oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico after about 88,200 gallons of oil were released from a Shell flow line about 90 miles off the coast of Louisiana, the company said Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Vessels have begun cleaning up an oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico after about 88,200 gallons of oil were released from a Shell flow line about 90 miles off the coast of Louisiana, the company said Friday.
